title: Rugby sponsor Gallagher told to 'publicly apologise' after race row
text:
Premiership rugby sponsor Gallagher has been told to publicly apologise for allegedly making racist remarks to an ex-employee after an explosive trial over the executive’s exit came to a close.

Former Gallagher employee Nawaf Hasan said he deserves an apology from the insurer after it emerged earlier this year that its UK boss Simon Matson called him a “complicated fat Arab” in a WhatsApp message, to which operating chief Gary Lashmar allegedly responded: “And a very greedy one.”

Speaking out after insurer Gallagher lost a court case against ­rival Ardonagh last week, Mr Hasan said: "Imagine how it felt to read grossly-offensive racist and Islamophobic slurs from former colleagues?

description: Premiership rugby sponsor Gallagher has been told to publicly apologise for allegedly making racist remarks to an ex-employee after an explosive trial over the executive’s exit came to a close.
